item.description:
Walking Tour of the Amoskeag Millyard

Saturday, June 18, 2011

10:30 a.m.-Noon

$5 members, $10 general public

Pre-registration is required

 

This tour provides an overview of the history of the Amoskeag Manufacturing Company and its vast millyard that stretches more than a mile along the Merrimack River. The company, which existed from 1831 to 1936, was a great success story of the Industrial Revolution in America. The Amoskeag's textile producing factory complex was the largest in New England, and the company also made steam fire engines, steam locomotives, and Springfield model rifles during the Civil War. This walk, led by Aurore Eaton, Executive Director, begins with an orientation in the Millyard Museum, and then proceeds into the heart of the Amoskeag Millyard.
item.how_to_find_us: The tour will start at the front desk.
item.name: Walking Tour of the Amoskeag Millyard
